headline: Awful when making a claim
review: All was OK when taking out a CAR insurance policy, but unfortunately a few weeks later, my car was hit from behind by another driver at traffic lights. The claim was first passed to One Call claims handling - a separate company - and then as I wanted my car to be repaired by the main dealer (although I have no idea why this should be an issue) it had to be passed onto Easidrive claims handlers instead. They are only interested in giving me a hire car and even though the main dealer will give me one for free, that is not an option apparently. The other option was to have my car taken to somewhere hundreds of miles away for repair, which I was not happy with. I am having to chase constantly for updates, although there are none as nothing is happening and the other parties insurers don't seem to want to agree to the repairs for some reason. It is a nightmare getting hold of anyone, but if they want to call you they ring continuously, which is very annoying as I cannot usually take calls during the day, being a teacher.Similar issues with getting Physio, they call you constantly too and then when I managed to speak to them, they had booked me in a place in Manchester and I live in Bedfordshire 2 hours away. Regardless of cost I will be moving to another insurers when this claim is finally settled. One call they are definitely not!!!

I logged in and tried "contact us" : I was taken round and round in ever decreasing circles, until I finally gave up and tried "complaints". Guess what, it had an ever increasing circle program, which, if I chose to, led me to the "contact us" program.I'm 80 soon and the last car insurance claim I made was in Kenya over 50 years ago. A week later I receive a text message and an email from Onecall threatening to pass my details over to debt collection. At first I assumed it was a typical scam message so I thought I would do my due diligence and investigate. Check my emails/messages including spam folders and can not see that I have had ANY contact from them. Log into my online account and sure enough I can see the policy has indeed been cancelled, but nothing about an outstanding balance. I join the queue to connect with a member of staff through the online chat feature again to find out the policy had been cancelled, and that I owed a fee. Disgusted that I received no confirmation of the policy being cancelled, or ANY notification of outstanding balances before receiving threats of debt collection. headline: Avoid one call at all costs. A waste of money
review: I noticed a leaking roof on 26/12 from the storm hit the northeast in 22-24/12. I pay for a home insurance, emergency cover and accidental cover with OneCall (policy OCI001/AD/000028410 ) . I called them on the 28/12, to be told that my emergency cover does not cover this storm as the winds speeds recorded in my area (not being told how exactly it was calculated), is not classed as a storm as it is at 53 mph which is below the 55mph stipulated in my insurance schedule (how convenient).So I was told to contact the basic home insurance (the underwriter -Arkel), I contacted Arkel on 28/12 and I was told I will be contacted about this in due time. When nothing happened for a whole week, I called them again on 06/01/24 the underwriter sent an email 08/01/24 initially requesting for a damage report, and photos of the damage, and previous insurance details, which I supplied promptly, 2 days later they returned with an elusive email, that I don’t have accidental cover, but when I showed that I do, and sent the schedule, they back tracked and said it doesn’t cover walls, only covers glass, they came with another answer, that the roofer report doesn’t say anything about a storm damage, which I challenged, but eventually told to either cancel the claim, get a formal repudiation or find my building guarantee to cover it instead, … DO NOT take insurance with ONE CALL, an absolute waste of money, I am absolutely disgusted at their customer service, the unprofessional and bad-mannered customers service (every time I call for any explanation, dialing the number given on the email, the person claims they are not the claim handler, although they confirm that they who have sent the email, and the claim handler is indisposed and as soon as I send an email with some query or response, I get an immediate response from the claim handler. This ordeal has been going on for almost 15 days going no where. ! (claim CPA196666), The other interesting thing I was told that the quote provided does not allow for reinstatement like for like but for amendments as a result of it not being fit for purpose! Am I supposed to repair the roof with half-way temporary measures in order to qualify for insurance? Instead of getting a rubber roofing that will stop the problem completely??I am glad i have some silicone to patch up the damage and to stop the ingress of more water.Honestly, it is a nightmare I don’t wish on anyone, trying to claim for a genuine problem and your insurance lets you down for “technicalities”. Using OneCall for insurance is money down the drain, you might as well don’t get an insurance, because they will do anything and everything, just not to pay.

review: AI7 was very helpful and managed to get my van insurance quote reduced, and very clear with what this contained.The only problem was for me finding a phone number on the internet to speak to an advisor,I had to do live chat to get it. Live chat is very slow and time consuming and inadequate for renewal when the quote is to high

headline: Rip Off
review: This company is online full stop. I have already highlighted the poor communication and that cost me £200+ Today it has cost another £241 because I ws in a NOn Fault accident that has not been settled so it counts as a Fault accident.If you dont pay then your policy is cancelled and there is no refund when it does get settled because company states I never disclosed it as a Fault accident!!!Biggest mistake ever taking insurance out with this company. It gave the lowest quote but the hidden charges are daylight extortion.And you need to be a Computer whizz kid to navigate the Computer portal tbhMY advice is to AVOID AVIOD AVIOD Never Again
name: Catherine

headline: Create barriers to stop complaints
review: All ok when things go right but they create barriers to stop you complaining by directing you to live chat and then blocking you from making a complaint. These tactics are in breach of Consumer Duty. There are no telephone numbers on the site - they should be renamed to NO CALL!

headline: PS1 Top Chatter
review: PS1 dealt with my query extremely well.Totally satisfied, thank you.
name: cliff

headline: I was over 1.5 hours on the phone…
review: I was over 1.5 hours on the phone trying to get cover on a new EV. I had to wait 1 hour for a live chat, then was given a wrong number to call for a new quote. That wasted another 30 minutes before getting Vienna who was the amazing. She could not get me the cover I needed at the price I wanted but she was the only good experience in nearly 2 hours of my life I'll never get back!
name: Emer Berry

headline: Pathetic
review: Pathetic. Left me on a busy A road for 6+ hours with no communication, no updates and sent a tow truck from an external company who said I should have been priority because of my location. Lodged a formal complaint and surprise surprise no call back from a manager as promised within an hour. Robotic advisors, no one cares, no one listens. Won't be using again
name: M boss

headline: My first experience
review: First time called breakdown and came to check car on my drive but still can’t start the car and need to be tow garage, only not happy that I need to tow to ONLY RAC appointed garage or else be charged, I have my own garage that trusted tooBesides this, overall, they response quite quick and messaged till their arrival
name: Ann Taylor

headline: The outstanding skill of the patrol…
review: The outstanding skill of the patrol man.  From my inital report of the breakdown he assessed that the battery was at issue and stopped en route to equip himself with  the correctd battery for my car model, which was exactly the right thing to do as he was able to fit the new one right away.
name: Evie Newman

headline: Expectations Exceeded!!
review: Having had a problem and logged it with the RAC I was given an estimated time of arrival. However, shortly after I received an update to say a passing patrol would be with me much sooner and, because the problem had been diagnosed in advance I was sorted and soon on the road.Expectations exceeded! Thanks
name: Tony N

headline: Trying their best in tricky circumstances
review: Trying their best in tricky circumstances - Sunday night, Storm Isha.No patrol available originally.Patrol (George) was brilliant.The taxi drivers were efficient & friendly.Lack of patrols late night/early hoursTook a long time to solve (17 hours)Communication got lost somewhere in this timeThe rescue was marked as finished due to a patrol turning up & me not being there - I was in a hotel 12miles away & not got a message.I had to keep ringing to see progress. Even one of the call people thought I'd been forgotten.The hotel & breakfast were much appreciated.
name: Nuala Keller

headline: The RAC man was amazing!
review: The recovery truck arrived within 2 hours, despite me being warned it could be around 4-6 hours wait. The man who came in the truck did a temporary repair on my damaged tyre but because he was worried it wouldn't last the journey to my garage, he followed me the whole way there. I am so grateful to him, he was brilliant!
name: Jo

headline: Excellent service!
review: Our car was making a horrendous noise. We phoned the RAC. We were kept informed of the engineer’s arrival. He arrived promptly and was able to resolve the problem swiftly. The engineer was polite and informative. All in all an excellent service!
name: Rhoda

headline: Easy to follow request for assistance…
review: Easy to follow request for assistance on the link and updates with eta, at regular intervals. The mechanic who came out was really helpful and knowledgeable. Had a new battery installed in record time and I was very happy the car started right away. Many thanks for a great experience. So glad I chose breakdown cover with the RAC!
name: Katrina  Glanville

headline: Appalling length of time to attend
review: Appalling length of time to attend. Constant shifts in timings. Only able to communicate via an app. Extremely difficult to get accurate updates or through to talk to a person. This is a company who appears not to want to talk to their customers and only wants manage everything via the use of technology. This is not the way to relate in a human world. I will not be renewing.
name: Jelli

headline: The gentleman was 100% more qualified…
review: The gentleman was 100% more qualified than the call out gentleman that came to me last Wednesday. I think he was called mr Jeffries. He found the exact problem which was a totally different diagnoses than the call out on Wednesday . I want to down mark Wednesdays and give the extra stars to mr jeffries. Not only did he find the real problem he also came to me in record time . Amazing work polite and understanding .please can you tell him he was spot on and I have had all my electrics re soldered .
name: Debbie

headline: Excellent customer service
review: The person I spoke to was very patient, listened carefully and was obviously knowledgeable.  HisExplanations were really clear and made the decision to take up cover very easy.I would definitely recommend the RAC to friends and family.
name: JC

headline: battery dead
review: Great service from recording recovery on app, to when driver arrived and was very polite and easy to talk with and explain issue and help beyond to make sure everything was okay before leaving. Thank you
name: SK

headline: Such a great guy showed up
review: Such a great guy showed up - reassuring and kind and got the repair sorted quickly. Thank you RACALSO the communications about when he’d arrive were good,  with regular updates

headline: Excellent service
review: Hi. Thank you  RAC, especially James for coming to my rescue tonight in Leeds. Was sorted within 60 minutes and kept informed whilst waiting. Well done on a first class service and top class mechanic
name: Regina

headline: DECEIVERS
review: They don’t even deserve 1 star. Master deceivers. They don’t tell you recovery is not recovery if you have an accident or that apparently it’s a 12 month contract, even though I haven’t signed anything, and I only cancelled because they deceived me big time and now they want me to pay cancellation charge. Do not trust them. I only used them because they were giving a discount for blue light card holders. Now I have been ripped off by them.
name: Jay

headline: Unqualified technicians no proper…
review: Unqualified technicians no proper equipment to diagnose vehicles, rude service, terrible customer service. Overcharging customers and not worth your time or money in anyway and should be banned from recovering people's vehicles until training and upgraded equipment is purchased. If you want a recovery from this company then purchase a horse not a vehicle and they might get you back on the road. Worst company I have used for anything, I had a 16 year old technician in mercedes diagnose my issue in under 5 mins.  DO NOT USE IF YOU VALUE YOUR TIME OR MONEY

headline: Anthony was brilliant from the Bristol team explained everything perfectly it was a pleasure! Rachel
review: I wanted to renew my membership, it was joint with my father who resetly passed away ! I got through to customer service and spoke to Judy who was rude and did not explain things properly!

headline: Absolute shower. Save your money.
review: Called at 1630hrs with flat battery. Given several time slots that were constantly changed both up and down. Called their dreadful customer services after 1907-1937hrs times timeslot was missed to be told that I would be called back by management shortly. No call back so called back a further two times to be told they'd 'escalated' my case but no idea or update on when I'd get help..At no point did the useless, incompetent, uncaring, RAC show any desire to help me..It's 0651 the day after and still they've not helped me. What an absolute shower. Useless,  not fit for purpose. Go to the AA maybe?
name: P J Gardner

headline: Voted with my Feet
review: Had a renewal quote today and it's gone up 41% year on year. I've been with them for 21 years and have never been so insulted in my life - oh and didn't raise a claim in the last 12 months or indeed the last two years before that and can count the amount of times I've needed their help and therefore been a cost to them probably on one hand over 21 years and they still raise it by this crazy amount.Immediately looked at rivals and have joined The AA accordingly - they clearly haven't got a clue about customer loyalty and good riddance
name: Mike Scott

headline: I feel safer as an RAC member
review: Patrol arrived quickly within 40 minutes and much sooner than anticipated, despite major issues on a nearby motorway during rush hour. I was back on the road within an hour. I’ve been with RAC for many years and my membership is something I’d never let lapse.
name: Dianne

headline: Took 28 HOURS to recover my vehicle !
review: Broke down at 6pm on Saturday 20th on the motorway in the dark, had very limited data and unable to call a human . The only positive part of my review is an engineer did come out within 45 minutes who was very helpful and reassuring. He could not repair or tow my vehicle so I was then referred for recovery. Every hour for 8 hours I was told they were only 30 minutes away until 3am when I eventually gave up and got a taxi home. My car then wasn't recovered until 8pm the Sunday. Its a miracle it didn't get smashed to pieces on the motorway or worse cause harm to someone else. Rac were really uninterested and showed no empathy despite me having a young baby and it being pitch black in minus temperatures. Heartbroken with the service.
name: Heidi

headline: worst service ever.....
review: I got RAC breakdown cover two months ago, and it's been a letdown. They fixed my car once, but the second time was a disaster. The guy told me to drive for an hour to charge the battery, but it was just a waste of time and gas. When I called during a storm, they demanded an extra £85, even though I'm already paying monthly. This whole experience has me questioning their competence and customer service.
name: adri cardozo

headline: Awful service from the RAC
review: Awful service from the RAC.  After 5 hours the recovery guy arrived but despite knowing that there was unlikely to be an effective roadside repair he was not capable of recovering the vehicle because he had not been trained in towing a vehicle on a dolly.  Like sending a fireman to a blaze who cant use a hosepipe.  We had to wait another 3 hours for a third party flatbed to come and collect the car.  If we breakdown again we'll just google search the nearest recovery service and bypass the awful RAC.
name: Pete Burrows

headline: At such a busy time due to the snow and…
review: At such a busy time due to the snow and ice it took some time for the mechanic to arrive which was totally understandable. The mechanic was courteous and he k ew what to do to get us back on the road. He was so helpful explaining things to us and was so pleasant even after spending such a hard day in the freezing cold and snow. Thanks to the mechanic for sorting us out.
name: Thomas Shorrock

headline: Wait time ridiculous 5 hours
review: Wait time ridiculous 5 hours! Not a “breakdown service” as such as kept waiting for hours. Also, Our daughter in law broke down 2 weeks ago, she’s heavily pregnant and was with our two small Grandaughters in horrendous weather,  also given wait time of 5 hours, disgusting treatment and she told them she was heavily pregnant with the girls and they really couldn’t care. My husband had to go to her breakdown and jump start her! Shame on you RAC not prioritising vulnerable people and not employing more patrol staff
name: Nikki

headline: Great employee
review: Great employee. Arrived quickly. Sorted the problem, called a colleague to assist with parts. Followed me home to ensure no problem and retrieve his spare wheel.Initial eta was 5 hours, but he phoned me before I had sorted an alternative rescue, with a 10 minute eta.
name: john hargreaves

headline: Excellent Service
review: I had to call out the RAC today as I had a flat tyre. The mechanic arrived promptly. During the time it took to sort out the problem, Darren the mechanic, was very professional but was very friendly too.  I think Darren is a huge credit to the RAC. A very deserved five stars!!
name: Clare

headline: Wonderful and timely service
review: If you have to break down the RAC service is the best way to be covered (provided that you have mobile phone service)They were excellent -- just as on the tin and I felt cared for at all times. Remarkable, considering the weather!
name: Charles Turner

headline: Excellent service
review: The patrol kept in touch as he drove to my stranded vehicle. When he arrived, he quickly assessed the situation and came up with a plan which he duly executed with great professionalism allied to good humour.
name: Phil Moakes

headline: Very disappointed and wouldn’t use the…
review: Very disappointed and wouldn’t use the service anymore and not recommended. I was planning to get a new car and keep using their service but after had to pay too much for a cancellation. It feels like a proper scam. Horrible
name: Ja

headline: Shaun was great
review: Shaun was great , made sure I was safely away from the busy roadside near the A9 and diagnosed the problem with my car . He then took his time to explain fully what he had found and assisted in making sure I could return safely onto the busy road and make my way to thw garage
name: Ruth Porteous

headline: Competent patrol man
review: I was originally given a 3 to 4 hour patrol arrival time.An update time was later given, meaning my wait time was 2.1/2 hours which was much better than expected. He  resolved my problem quite quickly.
name: Elizabeth McElroy

headline: car stuck at home
review: RAC were busy and I was a lower priority as I was not away from home and away from potential danger, but a man called paul did come the same day who was  very experienced and got my car engine to run haveing located the problem and provided a tempoary solution ie the car was useable like this until I purchased a replacement relay unit.great comunication texts throughgout the day very pleased  that I had cover.
name: mr. springett

headline: The whole experience from getting in…
review: The whole experience from getting in touch to having the car problem solved was stressfree ,seamless and most efficient. Thank you for excellent service on a cold very busy day for the RAC workforce. Well organised and helpful breakdown service provider.
name: Jess Dorrett

headline: Join the AA or someone better ( Which…
review: Join the AA or someone better ( Which will help). I waited 30 hours for a home rescue. The updates by text were entirely inaccurate and not updated. I couldn’t take the risk of my family suffering in more risky circumstances (as I have family membership. Been a member 24 years and used them twice. Never again.
name: Guy Taylor

headline: Slow at everything, it seems…
review: I cancelled my renewal, opting for a different policy with RAC, as it was more appropriate for our needs. Almost two weeks later, they still haven’t cancelled my policy and have not refunded me the money. Currently going through a complaints process with them as a result. As far as breakdown response goes, I’ve used them twice in the past two years. In both occasions, it was the following day that they got to me. Overall very poor.
name: Farrell

headline: The App worked very well
review: The App worked very well, in the last I have had long wait times on the phone. I also appreciated the updates I received via text and the phone call to check what the problem was.  I also want to mention Tony who was friendly and professional. It was a very good experience all round. Thank you.
name: Claire

headline: The website updates are shoddy
review: The website details are poor. They keep you hanging on , and extend by an hour each time which is pretty insensitive. It would be much easier to just phone the customer back and let them know what time you're going to arrive. If it's going to be a 4 or 5 hour delay, just tell someone up front.
name: Kay Cameron

headline: So they left me on road from 20.00…
review: So they left me on road from 20.00 every 30 minutes I have sms next hour next hour next hour and finally they came 06:00 morning!!!! absolutely USELESS I did cancel of course RAC and jumb on Green flag honestly 1000000% better
name: Jim Tsallas

headline: I am an RAC member and had a service…
review: I am an RAC member and had a service done at home. The driver came spent an hour and a half and charged me £220. He then pressured me to get a new battery and said my fan is staying on and I need a new coolant sensor all of which will cost me a further £480. After the shock I looked into the batter for my car which cost me £55 pounds and took me five minutes to change. The sensor cost £8 and again I did it myself which took fifteen minutes.  I'm now looking to move to a more ethical company.
name: Mark Shearman

headline: Did not have to wait to long for…
review: Did not have to wait to long for recovery. How ever the recovery driver diagnosed a faulty thermostat unfortunately that was not the case. Head gasket had gone.
name: customer

headline: Broke down on 19/01/2024 at 3pm
review: Broke down on 19/01/2024 at 3pm. Reported my breakdown via the app as when I phoned I was unable to speak to a human.Lone women across someone's driveway and on double yellow lines only just off the main road.RAC didn't attend sent a recommended recovery vechile at 19.15pm that was unable to tow my vechile so had to wait another 1hr 15mins for another truck, finally got my vechile home at 20.24pm and as it was weekend had to wait till Monday to get my van to a garage at cost of £60 to me to recover the vechile from my house to the garage.Safe to say I won't be renewing my policy with the RAC after being with them for a few years.☆☆☆I have already made a complaint and was told there is nothing you can do!☆☆☆
name: Michelle Chapman

headline: Good service
review: 2 hour response time which was ok as I was in a safe place.  I was kept informed of when we might expect someone to arrive. Nice Mechanic 'Owen' explained the issue (battery) and sorted it straight out. Not too badly priced and importantly he got me on the road again.
name: Catherine

headline: RAC Engineer - knight in shining armour
review: I broke down on a country road with my 94 year old mother in the car.  I was in the middle of a call with the RAC when a RAC van stopped behind me to see if we were ok.  At that time the engineer had no idea whether I was with the RAC or not.  Anyway to cut a long story short Andy fixed the problem but the point is that this very kind man stopped to see if we were ok which is both above and beyond and he was on his way home too! So I am very grateful as I was worried my aged mother would get cold if we had to wait too long.
name: Paul Hancock

headline: Just because I broke down at home it…
review: Just because I broke down at home it was over 24hrs before rac came. I had plans and had to cancel. Also explanations re why car wouldn't start were poor. Told not to switch engine off as if did wouldn't start again so took it straight to garage but van did not follow. If car had stopped and vouldnt get it started again I would have had to call them out again
name: jean Bristo

headline: Quick to respond and I expected to wait…
review: Quick to respond and I expected to wait longer as I was at home with the broken down vehicle. The fault was found very quickly and advice given about what to do next as it wasn't possible to fix the garage. A part was needed at a garage
name: K Farren

headline: RAC did not keep to the time slot given…
review: RAC did not keep to the time slot given and then changed my slot to the following day. This was a four hour slot and was exceeded by one and a half hours. I was left waiting in for most of Saturday and Sunday. Maybe I was a very low priority because it was a home breakdown. On the positive side, the patrol man was excellent and did his best to get my car started.
name: Francis

headline: Reporting fault on line was great for…
review: Reporting fault on line was great for me but not for everyone? After that everything was brilliant. Attended in 30 mins. Useful updates. New battery needed...want to get one and fitted it!!
name: GERAINT EVANS

headline: RAC just don’t care.
review: Disgusting service.I’m disabled and had a flat. Was on my way back from hospital very unwell.They advised 40 mins, then 2 hours, then revised that to 8 hours. First they said 13:04, then 14:36, then was accused of lying by an agent. I’ve been sick over myself trying to avoid my car. People keep banging on my car window asking me to move. RAC don’t care.
name: Yas S

headline: Quick response
review: Phone answered promptly, technician contacted me after a short wait, on-site after about 20 minutes, fault located and fixed quickly
name: David Smith

headline: Would not recommend the RAC
review: Would not recommend the RAC.  My car would not start at home, and comforted by the fact, my policy had recently auto renewed, I rang the breakdown number to ask the RAC for help.  When the patrol guy arrived, I was quizzed about adding 'battery replacement' to my renewal.  I told him I had not.  Everything on the policy was as it was when I took out the policy in 2022.  Apparently there is a 7 day period on new policies and renewals, where the RAC will not replace batteries, which I was completely unaware of.  As I was ringing them on Day 8, they were suspicious and the patrol guy made me feel like a fraud.  I will be looking at alternative breakdown cover for next year.
name: Emma Magee

headline: Quick and efficient
review: The patrol man phoned within minutes of registering my problem. He was reassuring and kind. Two patrolmen arrived 15 minutes later and sorted the problem.
name: Jane Hill

headline: Certainly the worst customer service I…
review: Certainly the worst customer service I have experienced. Miss communication from the RAC patrol and phone service, and quite frankly even worse service from the customer service team. Simply rude.
name: Sarah Greenland

headline: 2 cars - 2 policies - 2 breakdowns - At The Same Time
review: We’ve had RAC cover on our cars over 9 years and we’ve had only one call out to date - 5 years ago.  Today, We have had an utter day of hell !!  The worst weather day of the year - (Storm Isha) At 7am, a crunching noise from the front left side of our Jaguar.  I told my partner NOT to drive the car and telephoned the RAC.  Being a hugely bad weather day, we exercised common sense and expected a longer response time.  That said, the RAC provided a regular text message update.  At 09:20, “Paul” arrived and swiftly diagnosed a snapped suspension coil spring.  He simply asked us where would we want our car recovered to . . . In summary the car was perfectly recovered to our chosen garage.  An excellent recovery time from first contact to completion . . . . AND THEN . . . . At 3pm, driving our other car, it decided to light the dashboard with “STOP - ENGINE FAILURE ” !!  ( RENAULT ) .   I couldn’t believe it.  No calls in 5 years and now two in one day !!!  2 cars - 2 separate cover policies.  Thankfully I had arrived at work at this time.  I contacted the RAC again and stated the situation.  I did lessen the urgency of time to attend as being fair to the RAC on a hugely bad weather day, I respected that there were more urgent cases to deal with.  I informed them of this.  The RAC again kept me well informed as to when they would arrive.  This time, it was “Thomas” who arrived.   Thomas was utterly brilliant, the wind howling, the rain lashing down.  I think I made his day by getting our Renault undercover in a well lit heated building owned by my employer.   Thomas was incredible thorough and even had the car raised to discover the EXACT problem.  A particular non common part was needed.  The repair couldn’t be completed there and then.  Thomas offered to recover the car to a chosen garage.  I spoke to a mobile mechanic who stated that they could fit the part on site.  I declined the recovery option.  Thomas was, again superb. I would recommend RAC 1000% . . . They may be a bit more expensive than some you see online but I believe you get what you pay for.  The RAC has NEVER EVER let us down.
name: Joseph Johnson

headline: Phoning the RAC in an emergency is not easy.
review: Phoning the RAC breakdown and accident helpline number (0333 2000 999) is not easy because you have to go through three sets of options before you reach a real person.  Firstly, a taped voice asks whether you have RAC cover already or whether you are a non-member wanting to buy cover.  Well, it's a breakdown number - surely non-members should call the sales number?  Why delay the response to an emergency call?  Secondly, a tape asks whether it's a new breakdown or one you've reported already and  advises you to report it online or via the RAC app.  Hmm, why would I be phoning if I could do that?  Thirdly, you press one to speak to someone but before that there's a taped warning about aggressive behaviour towards the RAC staff.  This suggests to me that many people get angry with the RAC phone response, which I can understand after that runaround of options and taped voices plus ID checks on you and your car.  I cancelled my request for breakdown help because a bored-sounding person told it would take at least two hours and it could be longer - my call was 'in the system', so she said, with no specific or estimated time at which help might arrive.  This isn't user-friendly or convenient at a stressful time.  If you don't have a smartphone and you're away from internet access, the RAC is not for you.  I don't know how other breakdown services work and I don't know when RAC help might have arrived, but my recent experience was disappointing.  The adverts offer peace of mind but that's not my feeling now.

Notified by an email that went into my spam folder.I phoned up to inquire as to why it had gone up so much? 'Well there is a cost of living crisis going on' I was told!Yes I know that! After having my hours at work reduced to 11hrs a week from 35 I know there's a cost of living crisis on!!Anyhow, RAC 'kindly' reduced it down to £10 a month, 'I won't be renewing when the contract is over' I told the customer service rep, to which he replied, 'well you might get a better deal when it comes up for renewal' (?????!!!!!???!!!!)Shocking! Valued customer my @rse!! I don't care if they offer me the original fee, I will be moving onto another breakdown cover.It's disgusting that a company can treat customers like that. My insurance was the same (doubled) so I moved. Companies should think about their current users, you'll only lose them eventually!I'll be switching my breakdown cover when my current contract ends!

From then they were starting give me the fake promises and fake delivery date. When ever I contact the customer care they car are telling that i will be getting a call back from the logistics team because they are handling the delivery's and i don’t even get a call from them. From Monday they postponed the delivery to Wednesday and I waited till night to get an  updation and around 8pm when i ring them they told me that my delivery has postponed to Friday on Thursday when i ring the customer care they told that i will be getting a call from there escalation team and a lady called me back from the escalation team and she was not even interested in answering the question i asked her regarding the date of delivery and she was repeating that my car will be delivering on Friday and she shouted towards me and she cut the call and left. And I waited till midnight on Friday 12/01/2024 for an updation and nothing happened and on Sunday when i again ring RAC and raised the issues i got a call from RAC asking some apologies on delay and told they have assigned the delivery job to one of there agent and they will be collecting the car on Monday (15/01/2024)from them and and they will be delivering on the same day. On monday when I emailed to the logistics team they told me that they postponed the delivery to Tuesday due to the sickness of the  delivery driver and again they postponed the delivery date from Tuesday to Wednesday, and finally yesterday(17/01/2024)they delivered the car.They took 21 days to deliver my car after the breakdown and I received the worst customer care service of my life from the RAC and i have never seen such irresponsible people telling with lies and giving fake dates and promises. I didn’t expect this from a reputed company like RAC, due to this i went mentally stressed and mentally down and for these 21 days i was struggling to travel and they didn’t even hire me a car at beginning. And last when i checked the car after the delivery the disc pad was totally rusted and I don’t even know how did they treated my car on these 21 days.

headline: RAC declined to attend a breakdown on country road, involving a lone, pregnant female.
review: I broke down on a country road, just before some temporary traffic lights, on Wednesday 10th January at approximately 5.30pm. I was a lone, pregnant, female with a 2 year old daughter in nursery. My husband was in Sweden at the time and no family nearby. I called the RAC asking for assistance but they stated I needed to notify the police first to make the area safe before they would attend. I acted on this immediately and called them back to say the police were on their way and to again ask for breakdown assistance. They reported they could not come out as I was broken down in a ‘live lane’ (a country road) and needed to be towed to somewhere safe first before they could attend, as it was ‘too dangerous for their men’. I queried this as I was under the impression breakdown companies are able to tow cars to a safe location, as this is a service we have paid for in our policy. They again stated it was too dangerous for them to come out. This left me with no option but to use another tow company, which subsequently charged me £250. Totally unacceptable and I have lost complete trust in any security that the RAC state they provide in a situation such as mine (I.e. a relatively normal breakdown occurrence). Having spoken to others who have broken down in much more dangerous situations (e.g. on a roundabout in rush hour), it seems this is strange as they have been attended to by the AA straight away with no problems. I submitted a formal complaint to the RAC via their website, asking for resolution of this and a refund of the cost of having to use a private tow company. They were unwilling to discuss / provide any compensation for such a poor service and closed the complaint. We have now made a follow up complaint. It was a very stressful situation for me, being pregnant and alone in the dark on a country road, with no family nearby, and the RAC declined to help in any way, despite having breakdown cover with them. I am Exceptionally disappointed and will not be renewing with them in the future.
name: Laura Coles
